  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.ComponentImplementedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI, fr.upmc.components.ports.InboundPortI, fr.upmc.components.ports.PortI, ComputerServicesI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ComputerServicesInboundPort
extends fr.upmc.components.ports.AbstractInboundPort
implements ComputerServicesI
    The class ComputerServicesInboudPort implements an inbound port offering the ComputerServicesI interface.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Computer.AllocatedCore allocateCore()
      allocate one core on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.
      Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocateCores(int numberRequested)
      allocate up to numberRequested cores on this computer and return and array of AllocatedCore containing the data for each requested core; return an empty array if no core is available.

        public Computer.AllocatedCore allocateCore()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ComputerServicesI
        allocate one core on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Specified by:

      • allocateCores

        public Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocateCores(int numberRequested)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ComputerServicesI
        allocate up to numberRequested cores on this computer and return and array of AllocatedCore containing the data for each requested core; return an empty array if no core is available.

        Contract

         pre    numberRequested > 0
 post   return.length >= 0 && return.length <= numberRequested
        Specified by:
        allocateCores in interface ComputerServicesI
        Parameters:
        numberRequested - number of cores to be allocated.
        Returns:
        an array of instances of AllocatedCore with the data about the allocated cores.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
